title: Barbara Bedell: When it's fair time even 'crabs' are welcome
text: Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 2:01 AM Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 2:01 AM » Social News An apple is an apple unless its name is “crab,” and then if picked from the tree and bitten, it’s as bitter as an unripened persimmon. But its pink blossoms in spring are magnificent, they’re beautiful in flower arrangements, and the deer make spectacles of themselves standing on hind legs decimating the lower branches. Still, a tree is a tree, and the crabapple is low enough to the ground to be an appealing challenge for young people to climb. Andrew Keller loves to climb trees, and his mother has a special recipe for homemade crabapple sauce. When Shari Farrell spotted Andrew in the tree, his adventure became a promotion for the 40th annual Apple Time Fair at the Cornwall Presbyterian Church at 222 Hudson St. in Cornwall on Hudson. It is taking place from 10 a.m.-3 p.m. today, and if attending from a distance, it will be a lovely drive through the beautiful countryside with the leaves offering a magnificent show. The fair will have plenty of baked goods, crafts and holiday items. Also there’s a Bargain Basement sale with gently used books, games, toys and jewelry. The snack booth will be open as well as the gourmet coffee corner. Enjoy. Happening today - Safe Homes of Orange County will benefit from a concert today, titled “An Evening of Music and Giving,” at the Sugar Loaf Performing Arts Center Pavilion on Kings Highway. Featured will be vocalist Jim Kirk with Lou Balascio on keyboard, Vito Petroccitto, guitar, and Paul Beretta, drums. Doors open at 7 p.m., showtime is at 8. Tickets are $25 and will be available at the door. For information, call 845-610-5900. - A dinner-dance to benefit the Guild of St. Margaret’s Soup Kitchen will be from 6-11 p.m. today at Holy Cross Church in Slate Hill. Catered by Catherine’s in Goshen, it has been organizated by Cyndi Franchio at 978-4045. Tickets are $65. Cyndi, her family and friends, annually prepare a Thanksgiving and Christimas Day meal at the Soup Kitchen which is housed in Grace Episcopal Church in Middletown. Donations are welcome. - Reservations are due today for the Downing Park Planning Committee “Celebration of Autumn” from 3-6 p.m. Sunday. Tickets are $30 and available by calling 914-213-1486. - Newburgh’s 28th annual International Fall Festival will be from 11 a.m.-4 p.m. today at UNICO Park on the Newburgh Waterfront. A rain date is Sunday, same time and place. This and that - Robert Schiela is the new commander of the Catholic War Veterans Post 386. He succeeds James D. Peloso, a two-term commander who stirred tremendous growth and post activities, including becoming the largest post in New York State. - The Rev. Darrell Lewis, pastor of the Fellowship Baptist Church in Highland, is extending a hand of friendship to visitors on Sunday, which is Friend’s Day. Following the 11 a.m. service the male membership is preparing a chicken barbecue. For information, call 691-6961 or 691-8344. - Weather permitting, a group of wheelchair veterans with spinal cord injuries will be visiting Masker’s Orchards at 45 Ball Road in Warwick at around 11 a.m. Sunday. All are receiving care at the James J. Peters Veteran Medical Center in the Bronx. Welcome. - First-place winners in the recent Warwick Applefest Apple Pie Baking Contest are Jennifer McCarthy of Newburgh, in the adult division, and Ellie Pfohl, 10, of Warwick, junior division. In the Apple Pie Eating Contest, Robert Baez of Newark, N.J., was first in the adult large pie category, and Gianna Verduzzco, 9, of Garfield, N.J., was first in small pie division. - Nick Constantino, district governor of Rotary District 7210, visited with a group of Siberian entrepreneurs recently who were guests of the Rotary of Shawangunk Ridge (Mamakating) where David Sawransky is president.
